alert.note: Alert for Eastern Schenectady; Montgomery; Schoharie; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer; Western Schenectady (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 3:06AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A NARROW BAND OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN FULTON... EASTERN SCHENECTADY...SCHOHARIE...SOUTHERN HERKIMER...WESTERN SCHENECTADY...AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A narrow band of moderate to heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 305 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Duanesburg to near Jordanville and moving southeast at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Amsterdam, Johnstown, Little Falls, Canajoharie, Fonda, Duanesburg, Fort Plain, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Delanson, Ames, Rotterdam Junction, Tribes Hill, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, Glen, Oppenheim, Charleston, Fultonville and Palatine Bridge. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 27 and 29A. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Schenectady; Montgomery; Schoharie; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer; Western Schenectady
